company_short_desc: First modular, portable and affordable biotech laboratory for students.
company_long_desc: 42LAB  is the first modular, portable and affordable biotech laboratory for students. With Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education becoming required in OECD countries, most schools struggle to introduce biotechnology to their students due to high equipment cost and troublesome experiment preparation. 42LAB solves this problem by providing a portable modular biotech equipment for students to conduct experiments as well as a companion app which serves as an electronic manual for students and a management tool for teachers. Our vision is to bring biotech experience to every student like what Raspberry pi does for computer science.
founders_info: Dr. Yasaman Nematbakhsh  (CEO) is an expert in novel biomedical engineering fields such as microfluidics and biodesign with nearly 10 years of experience in biology and engineering. She has won numerous scholarships and awards for her outstanding work in her PhD at National University of Singapore and had been a crucial member of 3 startups.

Dr. Data Ng  (CTO) is a hardware expert with a PhD in physics from Hong Kong University. As a director of a secondary school and court member of a university in Hong Kong, he has extensive network with schools and knows educational system inside out.

company_short_desc: Accelerated Dynamics is building technology to drive the 4th industrial revolution
company_long_desc: Accelerated Dynamics  use machine learning, planning and multi-agent technologies, to transform drones, autonomous cars, satellite systems, and IoT devices into AI controllable assets which no longer require human operators. Our aim is to ease and promote the use of collaborative robots (aerial, ground or underwater) for business to enable the 4th Industrial Revolution.
founders_info: Mantas Gribulis  is a Robotics Engineer with a Masters degree in Robotics and Artificial Intelligence from KCL. His areas of expertise are Artificial Intelligence, Scheduling and Planning and Robot Operating System. His Master’s thesis at KCL, titled, “Intelligent Planning for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Systems” integrated cutting edge A.I. planning techniques into Robot Operating System to simulate fully autonomous UAV behavior in mission critical scenarios.

Umar Javed Wani  has a Masters degree in Robotics, Systems and Control from the highly prestigious ETH Zurich. He has a bachelors degree in Mechatronics Engineering. Umar has worked with some of the top researchers in the field of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, such as Prof. Rolf Pfiefer and Prof. Fumiya Iida, during his stay at ETH Zurich and has authored research papers on topics such as autonomous wheelchairs and soft sensors.

company_short_desc: The green toolbar transforming communication
company_long_desc: AccuRx  is developing data-driven diagnostic software to eliminate inappropriate antibiotic use and tackle antimicrobial resistance (AMR). AMR is one of the greatest societal threats, currently responsible for 700,000 global deaths each year, with this figure projected to rise to 10 million deaths by 2050, and a 3.5% hit to GDP. We solve this by combining decision support, behavioural science and data science, and starting in primary care.
founders_info: Jacob Haddad  read Engineering, Economics and Management at Oxford. He has led healthcare projects in quality improvement, performance improvement and outcome based commissioning.
Laurence Bargery  read Physics at Cambridge. He previously developed optimisation software for the oil industry, and in his spare time built and sold sports competition software

company_short_desc: Extremely reliable, wireless monitoring solutions for the world's most challenging industries
company_long_desc: Ackcio  builds extremely reliable, wireless monitoring solutions for the world’s most challenging industries, like construction. Their end-to-end solution integrates with any industrial sensor and transmits sensor readings wirelessly to their cloud services where the data gets stored and analyzed. Ackcio’s patent-pending wireless data collection protocol is capable of automatically learning an environment and fine-tuning radio parameters to ensure that no data gets lost during transmission of sensor readings.
founders_info: Mobashir Mohammad  is a wireless networking expert with 9 years of experience. He has won several awards for his outstanding PhD research in reliable wireless data collection protocols at NUS.
Nimantha Baranasuriya  completed his PhD in wireless networks at NUS. His patent-pending techniques on improving the reliability of VoIP applications on Wi-Fi networks have been integrated in Skype

company_short_desc: Building a conversational AI, Ada for first round tech interviews.
company_long_desc: Adaface  is building a conversational AI, Ada for first round tech interviews that candidates love (100% interview turn out). Ada can analyse the candidate’s thought process, give timely hints and ask follow-up questions to accurately gauge skills. Ada shortlists the most qualified candidates for the role, and now companies can invest more time engaging the top candidates.
founders_info: Deepti Chopra  did her undergrad at IIT, and research at Caltech where she improved accuracy of ML algorithms used to predict earthquakes in California’s early warning systems. As engineer #2 at vahan.ai, she built a WhatsApp chatbot for recruitment/ training of blue collar workers (currently used by Uber, Flipkart, Grab etc). She previously built and launched an outbound hiring tool (Jobhash).

Siddhartha Gunti  graduated with research in context based machine translation from IIT. At Goldman Sachs, he developed equity swap quantitative models as Senior Quant. As the first engineer turned PM at Headout, he built the V1 of the product and later a 13 member tech team with engineers from Google, Facebook and Goldman Sachs to scale the product to 1M users.

company_short_desc: Adbrain’s mission is to unlock the universe of data to build smarter businesses.

company_short_desc: Agrosight helps large agribusinesses in the Palm Oil, Citrus and Coffee sectors to detect and manage diseases at early stages.
company_long_desc: Agrosight  detects plant diseases early using hyper-spectral signals, dramatically reducing the cost of food production. Our technology detects diseases before they cause serious damage to crops. We do this by detecting minute changes in the light spectrum profile of a plant, signalling that a plant is affected days before any physical manifestation of damage is shown. This significantly reduces crop loss for farmers.
founders_info: Mayke De Freitas Santos  has been working as a policy advisor and project manager for several NGOs to minimise the impact that agriculture causes to biodiversity globally. Adolfo Posadas Durand  has a PhD in Physical Science and more than 25 years of experience in applied physics, mathematical modelling and complex systems applied to agriculture, soil physics, ecology, and environmental science.

company_short_desc: AI Palette creates successful FMCG product concepts at speed.

While at Visa, he was awarded and recognized as the top 2% of employees for his contribution.

company_short_desc: AIMS digitizes youth sports education through motion capture and artificial intelligence.

company_short_desc: Alcemy enables cement and concrete producers to cut costs and carbon
company_long_desc: Alcemy  enables cement and concrete producers to cut costs and carbon emissions.Producers in the 1T$ concrete industry are forced to make products excessively strong. This is due to limestone fluctuations driving strength up and down, with the only way to find out being a test that takes 28 days.Alcemy’s patented AI determines concrete strength within minutes, and suggests which wheels to turn to get it back on target, increasing cement plants’ profits by 5% and concrete batchers’ by 50%.The prototype is live in production in Leo’s home plant, and enabled Alcemy to select two more producers, including one of the largest in the world, to join its paid early adopter program.
founders_info: Leopold Spenner  has spent his life working with cement and concrete, growing up next to the plant his family has owned for 4 generations. Dr. Robert Meyer  holds a MSc & PhD in Machine Learning from TU Berlin. company_short_desc: Giving large-scale software engineers a more versatile development environment.
company_long_desc: Archanan  is revolutionizing supercomputing by changing how scientific software is developed. Supercomputing has a problem. We have access to tomorrow’s computers but we are still using yesterday’s practices. Developing applications for supercomputers costs too much time, too much money, and is too difficult. Archanan empowers the vast majority of scientists to use supercomputers through a suite of easy-to-use tools which can help design robust, scalable, and portable code. Our solution provides cost savings of an order of magnitude to supercomputing centers and increases productivity of their users by ten times. Archanan is facilitating the path toward the future of personalized medicine, self-driving cars, commercial space travel, quantum computing, and much more.
founders_info: Alex Nodeland  is a serial innovator who holds a degree in Applied Mathematics and Statistics from Stony Brook University, where he entered a PhD program at age 20. company_short_desc: ArrayStream Technologies help fund providers launch next generation AI-powered mutual funds.

company_short_desc: Atomionics is building atomic sensors for navigation and resource exploration.
company_long_desc: Atomionics  is building atomic sensors for navigation and resource exploration. Sensing technology is severely inadequate for a lot of applications navigation and positioning, pinpointing oil and gas reserves, tunnel detection etc.Atomionics builds atomic sensors harnessing quantum mechanical properties of the atoms. This enables measurement of parameters like gravity, acceleration and rotation with 1000x higher precision and accuracy than the current state of the art, leading to a completely new way of global positioning, and resource exploration.
founders_info: Ravi Kumar  has a PhD in Physics and an MSc in Photoinics. He has a decade of research experience including his PhD and post-doctoral research on cold atoms which is the bedrock of Atomionics’ technology.

Sahil Tapiawala  has a M.Sc. in Chemistry and a B.Eng in Electrical and Electronics engineering. He has worked extensively on integrated electronics systems. He was previously a Robotics Research Engineer where he built a multi-material 3D printer and miniaturized robotic stingray.

Eye-tracking will be the new blood test, enabled by the coming wave of mixed reality technology.

company_short_desc: BIOPSIN is transforming microbial diagnostics by enabling real-time detection of pathogens
company_long_desc: Industries are using a century old method to detect pathogens. This takes 5-10 days to get the results. This delay in microbial detection leads to batch spoilage, product recalls, disease outbreaks and loss of human lives. The global economic burden of microbial contamination is well over a hundred billion dollars.At BIOPSIN, we empower industries to detect pathogens almost in real-time with gold-standard limit of detection. Our device can detect multiple pathogens in a single test, is cost-effective and user-friendly. At BIOPSIN, we are fundamentally changing the way microbial detection is performed today.
founders_info: Amit KumarDr. Amit Kumar (CEO) has a PhD in Chemical & Biomolecular Engineering from NUS, Singapore. He has 10+ years of experience working with industries & govt agencies on their microbial safety needs.
Sheetal SinhaDr. Sheetal Sinha (CTO) has a PhD in Biophysics from NTU, Singapore. She is an expert in microbial interactions & detection.

company_short_desc: Blazar uses machine learning to predict cancer response to immunotherapy.
company_long_desc: Blazar uses machine learning to predict cancer response to immunotherapy.Immunotherapies are a groundbreaking cancer treatment curing patients with a success impossible five years ago. Unfortunately they work in only 20% of patients, may cause several adverse effects and are very costly to develop.At Blazar we apply machine learning to patient data providing predictions and insights on treatment response. This allows for better patient recruitment for clinical trials and better understanding on failure reasons.Leading clinical centers have already trusted their patient data with us and we are negotiating pilots with more than 20 partners around the world.
founders_info: Dora SabinoDora completed her PhD at Cambridge and has 14 years of experience in cancer research. Her work has influenced a number of articles in high- impact journals and she also led projects in industry modeling cancer treatment response.

company_short_desc: Saving millions in fuel costs by helping container ships leave port early.

company_short_desc: Carnot Innovations pioneers optimization of building operation costs by using AI-based predictive analytics to predict and preempt mechanical equipment failures.
company_long_desc: Carnot Innovations aims to be the brain behind a truly smart building. Our ground-breaking software platform enables persistent optimization of commercial building operational performance. Existing practices for maintenance of Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) Systems in commercial buildings are inefficient and outdated. Each commercial building (~10-15 floors, 75,000 GFA) on an average loses over 350,000 USD every year in energy and maintenance costs. We use advanced Machine Learning algorithms to predict failures on HVAC mechanical equipment and our actionable insights empower facility managers to perform targeted defect rectifications at optimal times. We are the first to enable AI based Continuous Commissioning and we generate over 20% savings in total Energy costs (approximately 200,000 in addition to Maintenance savings and increased equipment life.
founders_info: Ashish JustinAshish Justin is a Certified Energy Manager with a master’s in Automation from NTU Singapore. He has worked with clients like MGM MACAU, Sands China, Swire Properties etc. and has experienced the effects of inefficient maintenance first hand.

Chris ChoyDr Chris Choy is a data scientist and full stack developer. He has a PhD in statistics from the university of Oxford. He has over 10 years experience in research and in industry. His previous role in BASF involved root cause analysis, process optimization, time series analysis which is directly applicable to solve the problem here.

company_short_desc: CertSimple helps companies prove their identity online.

Mikhail Dubov  is a full-stack developer with a degree from Cambridge and background in data analytics, having worked at Citigroup.

company_short_desc: Circuit Mind is using AI to completely automate the design of electronic circuits.
company_long_desc: Circuit Mind  is using AI to completely automate the design of electronic circuits. Every year £40bn and 1.5bn hours are spent globally in tedious and repetitive circuit board design work. We are building extremely complex artificial intelligence that takes in the requirements for a circuit board and outputs the circuit board final design, ready for manufacture. This means better circuits, designed orders of magnitude faster, at a fraction of the cost.
founders_info: Tomide Adesanmi  is an electronic systems engineer with a Master’s from the University of Leeds. He spent over four years building high integrity AR displays for pilots at BAE Systems. His expertise in complex systems design is central to Circuit Mind’s technology.

Basilio Gentile  has two Master’s degrees, including one in Electrical Engineering, and a PhD from ETH Zurich with a focus on mathematical algorithms for complex systems. He declined postdocs at Harvard and Berkeley to start Circuit Mind. His mastery of high-performance algorithms is at the core of Circuit Mind’s solution.

company_short_desc: cirplus is the global marketplace for recycled plastics
company_long_desc: cirplus is the global marketplace for recycled plastics.cirplus is building the managed marketplace for recycled plastics. It digitizes and shortens the transaction process for buyers and sellers and leverages AI to guarantee consistent quantity, quality, and price.In the EU alone, more than €66 billion worth of plastic changes hands every year. cirplus has more than 40 companies on the waiting list and is matching purchase requests already.cirplus is also funded by Climate-KIC, the EU’s climate innovation initiative. For every ton of virgin plastic replaced via cirplus, 85% of CO2 emissions are saved.
founders_info: Volkan BiliciVolkan is a full-stack software and blockchain developer with 12+ years of experience working at industry leaders such as Brickblock and FCG. He brings 2+ years of hands-on IoT and plastic manufacturing automation process experience.

Christian SchillerChristian co-led and scaled BlaBlaCar Germany for 4+ years from day one; at his departure, the German platform had 6 million registered users, 120K monthly active users and 15 FTEs. He 
played a key role in the post-acquisition integration of mitfahrgelegenheit.de, a competitor with 35 FTEs.

company_short_desc: Cleo is an A.I. assistant to manage your finances.
company_long_desc: Cleo  is an A.I. assistant to manage your finances. Using machine learning we automatically classify your transactions, deliver relevant insights into your spending and give you a clear overview of your finances. And users can get all of this, just by sending Cleo a text.Rather than creating a bank, Cleo sits on top of existing infrastructure to give our users an elegant and user-friendly banking experience. By integrating APIs for banks and other financial service providers, Cleo aims to become a hub for each user’s banking activity.
founders_info: Barney Hussey-Yeo  holds a Master’s in Machine Learning from the University of Bristol and has spent the last year working as a Decision Scientist at Wonga, analysing financial data.

company_short_desc: ClickMechanic is a marketplace for car mechanics.
company_long_desc: ClickMechanic  is a marketplace for car mechanics. The service is underpinned by Europe’s first industry standard car repair quote engine. The system uses millions of industry data points combined with data mapping, cleaning and machine learning to provide greater transparency and trust to the car repair process
founders_info: Andrew Jervis  has a Masters Degree in Enterprise and Innovation from The University of Manchester, and previously worked in banking. He previously started an automotive parts aggregator which he sold prior to joining Entrepreneur First.
Felix Kenton  has a Masters in Information Systems from Imperial and previously started a gaming company.

company_short_desc: Researching and applying breakthrough AI methods to control milling machines.
company_long_desc: CNC  milling machines are at the heart of manufacturing with almost half a trillion dollars’ worth of components produced by them each year. Despite this, their software is in the dark ages. We’re researching and applying breakthrough AI methods to control these machines automatically and more optimally than ever before, revolutionising how the things around us are made. Our mission is to make milling machines one click devices that can produce a part easily, efficiently and with minimal human intervention, effectively halving the cost of their use.
founders_info: Theo Saville  has a master’s in manufacturing and mechanical Engineer from Warwick. He has worked in weapons development, surveillance equipment development for policing and counter-terrorism, industrial 3D printing research, as a freelance engineer, and in door-to-door sales.

Chris Emery  has a master’s in computing from Imperial College London. He has been programming since he was 12, and started selling shareware when he was 15. He co-created “EventBox”, which was acquired by Realmac Software. He then worked as a software engineer at Google, before leaving and founding and selling Five Sided Software.

company_short_desc: Inspiring kids to learn coding.
company_long_desc: Code Kingdoms  wants to inspire kids to learn one of the essential creative skills of the 21st Century – coding.
founders_info: Code Kingdoms  allows kids aged 6 to 13 to learn computational thinking by designing their own game levels with real JavaScript code, and then sharing them with friends. This also promotes essential skills like problem-solving, teamwork and time management.

company_short_desc: CodeReg makes regulatory change in finance as simple as a software update.
company_long_desc: CodeReg  makes regulatory change in finance as simple as a software update. Financial institutions face a mountain of regulation. Manual processes can’t handle the complex, interwoven and shifting rules, exposing firms to massive fines and costing billions to change systems in response. Our compliance engine automatically verifies and monitors financial compliance. We can provide real-time compliance insight and flag any potential breaches before it’s too late.
founders_info: Samuel Watts  spent four years in quantitative finance, building and advising on regulatory systems for both major European banking supervisors and financial firms. He holds Master’s degrees in Maths and Mathematical Finance from the Universities of Warwick and Oxford.

Stacy-Ann Sinclair  spent a decade building high-frequency trading systems and globally scalable data infrastructure for three tier one investment banks. As a VP at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, she led development of a unified platform for MiFID II compliance. She has a CS degree from City University.

company_short_desc: CogniScent provides AI guided early detection of neurodegenerative diseases
company_long_desc: CogniScent provides AI guided early detection of neurodegenerative diseases.60 million people are affected by Parkinson’s and Alzheimer’s worldwide, with cases doubling in the next 20 years. Diagnosis only occurs at advanced stages of the diseases.At CogniScent we develop a novel test for early detection. Using machine learning, we predict a personal risk score based on early symptoms, where smell plays a key role.We are currently testing our prototype, built on exclusive data from the University Clinic of Dresden. Our test will improve the lives of 2 million diagnosed people per year and help save US $60 billion in healthcare costs in Europe and the US.
founders_info: Kai LammelKai Lammel has over 10 years’ commercial experience in Marketing, Sales and Consulting roles. He launched and scaled a global scent- related business for BASF Nutrition & Health. In his last role, he led all commercial tasks in the founding process of a start-up for innovative brain imaging devices.

Micol de RuvoDr Micol de Ruvo is a Data Scientist with a PhD and Post Doc in Computational Biology and Biomedical Engineering. She has extensive experience in developing mathematical and ML models for medical applications and unique expertise in working with olfactory data to predict neurodegenerative disorders.

company_short_desc: Developing new information retrieval and machine learning based approaches for web search, automated professional assistance and task based IR.
company_long_desc: Context Scout  is a research-led software company developing new information retrieval and machine learning based approaches for web search, automated professional assistance and task based IR. After raising their seed round in 2016 they’ve expanded their team to include PhDs on topics such as NLP, knowledge representation and deep learning.
founders_info: Marc Sloan  has a PhD from UCL in Information Retrieval and is the author of the book ‘Dynamic Information Retrieval Modeling’. He has published extensively on the topic of predictive web search, including during his time working at Microsoft Research.

Andy O’Harney  holds a Master’s in Machine Learning from Glasgow University and worked on computational neuroscience for the Medical Research Council and Medical University of South Carolina before joining fintech startup Singletrack. Marc and Andy met on EF and started Context Scout.

company_short_desc: Our cutting-edge wireless sensors help construction companies stay on programme.
company_long_desc: Converge  is a hardware and software platform that works with existing sensors to store, analyze and display their data, automatically, in real­time. We charge a subscription fee per connected sensor, and a fixed fee for any hardware and installation.
founders_info: Raphael Scheps  is a Cambridge trained theoretical physicist, with years of experience in large-scale data analytics at Mellanox and the Weizmann institute.
Gideon Farrell  is an astrophysicist from Cambridge with 10 years of software experience. Gideon has worked on Intel’s pioneering IoT project, WISP.

company_short_desc: AI-powered creative inspiration for marketers.
company_long_desc: Creative AI  gives every business the power of a dedicated marketing team – what use to take them hours, now takes them just seconds. They currently use machine learning to automatically create social media posts, and they’ll later start optimising other marketing activities.
founders_info: Yazan Al Alami  has founded and grew 2 marketing companies, where he helped local and global brands 10x their reach and engagement on social media. He graduated with a Master’s in engineering from Imperial College London.
Lukas Dirzys  is an expert in optimised image and text generation and he won the Google Prize for the best Master’s dissertation at the University of Edinburgh.

company_short_desc: Better credit for all.
company_long_desc: Credit Kudos  is a challenger credit bureau developing a Financial Behaviour Score based on real-time financial data. The company recently became the first of its kind to receive full authorisation from the FCA as a Credit Reference Agency. The Credit Kudos platform gathers information from your online banking to determine your suitability when applying for financial products.
founders_info: Matt Schofield and Freddy Kelly  met studying Computer Science at the University of Manchester. Prior to founding Credit Kudos, Matt was leading Data Science teams for Universal Music Group (UMG) and CTO of UMG’s music discovery platform, SpinnUp. Freddy joined Bitnami (YC W13) after graduation where he was responsible for development of their cloud launchpad, deployed initially for Microsoft and later a number of other cloud vendors including Google, Amazon and VMWare. Freddy went on to be the first engineer at A16z backed financial analytics platform, TXN.

company_short_desc: A cutting-edge origination, trading and settlement platform built for the debt markets.
company_long_desc: CreditMint  is decentralising corporate lending. The corporate debt industry is migrating from a bank-led model towards smaller lenders. But these new-wave lenders are tied to constant cycles of reconciliation, and trading is slow and expensive. Furthermore, companies lose track of their creditors and the market is structurally illiquid.We fix this using a public blockchain as the shared ledger for corporate debt. We provide a dealmaking platform; a trading layer; and a settlements facility, all communicating with one digital asset on Ethereum.

company_short_desc: Crypto Squad helps traders create and manage crypto funds.
company_long_desc: Crypto Squad helps traders create and manage crypto funds. Blockchain technologies are helping democratize fund management. Crypto enthusiasts are setting up informal investment pools made of friends and family. These investment pools are insecure and unregulated. Funds are stored with the pool manager, making them an easy target for hackers. They operate in legal gray areas. Investors have no mechanism to track fund performance and remain crypto illiterate. Pool managers are unable to monetize and scale.Crypto Squad help traders quickly and securely setup these investment pools. Our proprietary wallets let investors mirror trades performed by the manager, while maintaining asset custody. Startup investments, bonds and many other financial instruments will soon be tokenized. Crypto Squad will become wealth management everyone can understand and access.
founders_info: Anthony Wilson  received a masters in computer science from Imperial College London. He’s a three time CTO and has advised Chinese state-owned enterprises on how to use blockchain for supply chain management. He’s been developing blockchain applications for six years.

company_short_desc: Developing quantum cybersecurity products.
company_long_desc: There will be 20 billion connected devices by 2020 in buildings, electric grids, transportation systems and other critical infrastructures. This creates huge security risk. We develop quantum cybersecurity products in the form of hardware and software which harness the best of both worlds, combining cutting edge quantum technologies with the best of modern cryptography. Our products are safe, secure, and can be integrated into existing network infrastructure with minimal disruption.
founders_info: Shahram Mossayebi  has a PhD in Post-Quantum Cryptography from Royal Holloway University of London. He also has an Information Security Master‘s degree. He has written scientific papers on the security of modern cryptosystems against quantum adversaries.

Patrick Camilleri  has a PhD in Neuromorphic Engineering from Otto-von-Guericke University in Germany. He worked at Philips Semiconductors Zurich where he designed semiconductor chips for mobile phones. Most recently Patrick was a Postdoc at the University of Manchester where he researched parallel computing.

company_short_desc: Data Hygge helps companies spot, prioritise and solve experience issues.
company_long_desc: Data Hygge  helps companies spot, prioritise and solve experience issues. Bad online experience is costing companies £62 billion. From broken buttons to long support wait times, there are thousands of potential issues. But no one way for companies to find them. We’re building a product that monitors customer touch points, automatically detects experience issues using machine learning, and gives companies the right information to fix them.
founders_info: Mikkel Dengsøe  spent 5 years at Google leading data science for customer experience. He has honed his machine learning techniques using the largest database of websites in the world.

Mario Hayashi  has a Master’s in Computing from Imperial College London. He built the analytics platform at Nimble Storage, handling petabytes of data. He has also led product development at multiple startups.

company_short_desc: DeltaBlock adapts traditional capital liquidity services for Digital Assets
company_long_desc: DeltaBlock adapts traditional capital liquidity services for Digital Assets.As any new asset class, Digital Assets are illiquid. Traditionally, this is solved by Market Makers, but the features of digital assets and the exchanges where they are traded demand new techniques.DeltaBlock uses cutting edge research in math and liquidity modeling to build algorithms which perform about 20x better when applied to Digital Assets.One exchange and the biggest issuer in France are signed up. We have strategic partnerships with Digital Assets issuance platforms in Europe and the UK. Furthermore, Deltablock has a strong pipeline with demos planned with 3 companies and 2 exchanges.
founders_info:
Maria Silvia ScettaMaria is an experienced trader and portfolio manager who has spent 7 years working for investment funds and institutions such as 
J.P. Morgan. She is a financial engineer and holds a MSc. in Finance. She has experience in highly illiquid markets such as frontier markets and in High Frequency Trading.

Hamza El KhalloufiHamza holds a PhD in liquidity modeling from Sorbonne University (Paris 1). He gained relevant experience in quantitative modeling in the banking industry. He has been involved in the Blockchain ecosystem for years and is a respected research fellow in the field of Digital Assets at Cambridge University.

company_short_desc: DOCLE is redefining the transcription industry with AI.
company_long_desc: Education, medical and legal being the key drivers of this market due to enforced regulations. Every year over a billion hours of audio/video has been transcribed in these industries. Current transcription process is manual, costly and simply prone to mistakes. Docle AI is redefining the way transcription done and making seamless with their unique AI platform.
founders_info: Narasimha SudaSimha has a Masters in Physics and Mathematics. During his research, he published high impact publications exploring non-linearity in neural networks. He also has 4+ years of experience in dealing with data ranging from voice, images, and text. He built his previous startup on pure data analytics & AI.

Abhinav YadavAbhinav has a Ph.D. in computational neuroscience. During his Ph.D. he worked with a huge amount of brain data and has vast experience in dealing with big-data using high performing computing. He also published high-impact publications exploring brain patterns using neural networks. His previous start-up deal with handling big data and optimization of high dimensional agricultural data.

company_short_desc: Crypto made easy.
company_long_desc: Donut  makes crypto easy. Their mission is to empower better financial health by democratising access to the new and emerging digital asset (read: crypto) ecosystem.
founders_info: Neel Popat  has over 7 years deep finance experience having worked at 3 top-tier investment funds managing >$150bn. Neel started his career at Rothschild and holds a first class degree in Financial Mathematics & Statistics from LSE/Harvard. He built his first business out of his bedroom aged 14.

Jordan Abderrachid  was one of the first backend developers at N26 bank. He brings with him deep tech experience, having built security architecture that 1M people use to transact with across Europe. He is an experienced blockchain developer and holds an MEng from École Centrale de Lyon.

company_short_desc: Helping news publishers and magazines to maximise their reach.
company_long_desc: Echobox  technology allows news publishers and magazines to maximise their reach by building personalised performance predicting algorithms on top of audience graphs plus detailed recommendations to improve performance.They work with top international publishers incl. Le Monde, Haaertz, Cosmopolitan and Vice.

company_short_desc: The fastest way to find and book great musicians.
company_long_desc: Marketplace for outstanding musicians

company_short_desc: AI driven diagnosis for upper GI Endoscopy
company_long_desc: Endovision provides AI driven diagnosis for the upper-GI endoscopy, by aiding the doctors in real time during the procedure, hence enabling them to perform better and faster.

He also has extensive software development and management experience.

Deepanshu MalikDeepanshu Malik has done masters in Computer Science at University of Southern California. He has extensive industrial experience, having building deep tech platforms in the Silicon Valley for over 6 years, which includes his experience of building autonomous driving software at Here technologies. Having worked on video analytics using Computer vision and Machine learning, Deepanshu’s skills are directly applicable in endoscopy video analytics.

company_short_desc: Quantum computing for bioinformatics and genomics.
company_long_desc: Genomics is one of the most computationally demanding disciplines. At  Entropica Labs  we build quantum computing software and algorithms for computational genomics and the life sciences. Our software gives genomics researchers in healthcare, drug development and agritech access to powerful new forms of statistical analysis and machine learning, enabling the delivery of personalised treatments, safer medication, and more productive crops.
founders_info: Tommaso Federico Demarie  is a physicist with more than 8 years of experience in the field of quantum computing. He received his PhD in Quantum Information and Computation from Macquarie University, Sydney, in 2014, and then worked as a Postdoctoral Fellow at Singapore University of Technology and Design and at Singapore’s Centre for Quantum Technologies. He has published more than 10 research articles on quantum physics, with a focus on quantum gravity, quantum relativistic information, and cloud quantum computation.

Ewan Munro  has a PhD from the Centre for Quantum Technologies at the National University of Singapore, where he specialised in modelling physical platforms for quantum computing and information processing. He also has a Master’s Degree in Mathematical Physics from the University of Edinburgh, and was a visiting scientist at the Institute for Photonic Sciences in Barcelona.

company_short_desc: Eyn is a biometric security company.
company_long_desc: Eyn  is a biometric security company.  We combine advanced facial anti-spoofing and public key cryptography to transform your smartphone into an ID verification device with military grade security. This gives anyone an unbreakable biometric identity key.
founders_info: Hasan Sheikh Faridul  has a PhD in computer vision and machine learning. He worked for 7 years in the security industry in world leading companies such as Safran Security and Identity. As a research scientist, he developed fingerprint recognition algorithms that is now deployed on major international Airports.

Mohamed Ben Arbia  completed his master’s at EPFL specialising in signal processing and machine learning. He worked at Technicolor R&D on real time audio application and was a research student at LCAV lab at EPFL.

company_short_desc: FabricNano designs artificial cells that produce chemicals 100x faster
company_long_desc: FabricNano designs artificial cells that produce chemicals 100x faster.Fermentation powers a $5Tn chemical market, from bioplastics to sweeteners to emulsifiers for your soap and shampoo. Billions are spent bioengineering incremental improvements to the microbes that make these products.At FabricNano, we extract only those microbial components necessary for fermentation, and fix them on a woven nano-fabric made of DNA. This gives 100x faster production, higher purity, and adaptability.We are already prototyping our technology with 3 multibillion dollar chemical companies and we have filed the first of many patents for designing biology outside the living cell.
founders_info:
Grant AaronsGrant is a former Economics PhD at London Business School where he taught microeconomics, markets and econometrics. Grant has studied systems engineering and developed the mathematical modelling behind the nowcasting platform released by the Federal Reserve in 
New York; cited by the FT and Bloomberg.

Ferdinando RandisiFerdi has a Computational Biophysics PhD from Oxford University. He co-authored oxDNA, the world’s most accurate DNA simulation engine, known for its reliability and versatility in nanostructure analysis. His models study how small local changes can improve the global stability of DNA structures.

company_short_desc: Faultless AI eliminates human error in manufacturing.
company_long_desc: Faultless AI  eliminates human error in manufacturing. Human error costs manufacturers $2.6 trillion every year. Robots aren’t the solution. There are millions of tasks that will remain beyond the abilities of robots for generations. With computer vision, our solution makes people reliable.
founders_info: Nigel Boielle  completed a Master’s in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Auckland. He has over 13 years of experience in the automotive industry, working as a chief engineer at Ford, Jaguar and Ricardo. He has experience in every step of the design and manufacturing process.

Steve Gaukrodger  has more than 13 years of experience using cutting edge technology to solve complex human problems. He has built air traffic control interfaces, medical devices and artificial intelligence systems for poker. He has three degrees from the University of Canterbury, including computer vision and psychology.

company_short_desc: AI powered software platform that understands manufacturing data to reduce the cost of product failure.
company_long_desc: Manufacturing companies lose up to 40% of their sales revenue because of poor quality products or defects. What’s worse, these defects could be prevented by using data that is already flowing through manufacturers’ production lines. At  FireVisor , we provide AI powered software platform that understands manufacturing data to reduce the cost of product failure. We are saving 15-55 billion every year , and our client list includes leading giants in high volume manufacturing.
founders_info: Surbhi Krishna Singh  has a Master’s in Engineering from the NUS. She has extensive experience in manufacturing and industrial automation, and worked for industry giants like Micron and Seagate. She has 2 award winning engineering projects under her belt, and has built an integrated systems that saved 80% cost.

Long Hoang  has a Bachelor’s in Computer Science from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. He built machine learning models that analyze millions of transactions for outliers. He also designed data pipelines that scales to tens of billions of requests per month. He started the largest hackathon in greater China region, and attended a fully funded Entrepreneurship program at Stanford.

company_short_desc: Cutting edge, intelligent planning and scheduling software, powered by AI.
company_long_desc: Flexciton  is building cutting edge, intelligent planning and scheduling software, powered by A.I. to help end-users of industrial machinery improve operational efficiency and reduce operational cost.
founders_info: Jamie Potter  has a Master’s in Mathematics and Statistics from the University of Oxford, where he graduated top of his year. He worked for a consultancy firm specialising in Energy. He was the lead developer of more than twenty software projects for large customers such as DECC, National Grid and RWE. The software was used to make multi-billion pound decisions.

Dr Dionysios Xenos  did his PhD at Imperial College London, researching the optimisation of rotating equipment to reduce operational costs. He published 12 papers on the subject, and collaborated with world-leading chemical company BASF and one of the largest gas suppliers, Statoil, to put his research into action.

company_short_desc: Flowlity is building the world's first cognitive supply chain network
company_long_desc: Flowlity is building the world’s first cognitive supply chain network.2 trillion dollars are lost every year due to supply chain management inefficiencies. We are solving this once and for all. Flowlity is a SaaS platform, powered by AI, that redefines how supply chain managers position stocks.We are leveraging the fact that companies are interconnected through their supply chains to reduce stocks by 40% compared to legacy solutions. And the more suppliers using the solution, the better the results.We started a paid pilot with Saint-Gobain, two of its suppliers and a strong pipeline of other manufacturers.
founders_info: Jean-Baptiste ClouardJean-Baptiste has 7 years of Supply Chain experience, working in 3 companies: Anaplan, Quintiq, and Dassault Systèmes. There, he led a team of 15 people that designed and built a new product. He also sold Supply Chain solutions to some of the biggest french companies : Lafarge, Danone, Airbus and L’Oréal.

Karim BenchaabounKarim, CTO of Flowlity, has 4 years experience as a machine learning engineer in multiple sectors. He was the first data scientist hired at Axa France, and most recently at Criteo where he led the creation and deployment of a new product that scaled from 1 to 100 million ads per day.

company_short_desc: Changing the way blood conditions are diagnosed.
company_long_desc: Gallenco delivers AI medical imaging diagnostic solutions to automate archaic laboratory tests.  Our first product combines Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision to automate the 600 million blood films tests performed each year.The peripheral blood film test serves as a screen for Leukemia, Anemia and other conditions. Today, 20% or 600 million blood tests require manual review under the microscope.
founders_info: Adonis PanagidisAdonis Panagidis did presales and technical consulting for multinational corporations across the region during his time at Amazon. He is a computer science graduate and holds a nanodegree in self-driving cars where he gained expertise in computer vision and AI.

Nicholas CapelNicholas Capel holds a Masters degree in AI from Cambridge University. Most recently he held the position of CTO in a chest X-rays diagnostic startup and was previously a fullstack developer for TripAdvisor.

company_short_desc: Ginie AI turns term sheets into contracts.
company_long_desc: Ginie AI  turns term sheets into contracts. A first draft of a 100 page M&A contract would have taken days – it now takes seconds. To make this possible, we use a new type of generative adversarial nets developed from our prior research. In addition, we have developed a patent-pending method to access highly confidential data for the first time.
founders_info: Rafie Faruq  has an MSc in Machine Learning from UCL. He has founded multiple tech startups, and has commercial experience as a derivatives trader.

Nitish Mutha  is a deep learning expert with an MSc in Machine Learning from UCL. He has 5 years’ software engineering experience in a Fortune 500 company. Nitish has won several national awards for technical projects.
Madeleine Royle  previously qualified as a solicitor from a major US law firm. As Product Manager she brings her experience in financial and corporate law to Ginie AI.

company_short_desc: Discovering better drugs, quicker and at half the cost.
company_long_desc: GTN  is a quantum leap in drug discovery. We search the astronomically large space of potential drug molecules with our patented technology based on quantum physics and machine learning, discovering drugs that were previously hidden from view. We can discover better drugs, more quickly, at half the cost.
founders_info: Noor Shaker  is a professor from Aalborg University in Copenhagen with ten years of academic experience in machine learning. She has published more than 50 papers with 1000 citations and an entire book on generative networks. She has won a number of awards and grants for her research.

Vid Stojevic  has spent the past ten years working on string theory and tensorial methods in quantum physics. He has held postdocs at UCL and the University of Vienna, published in numerous high impact journals, and his work has been presented at leading conferences.

company_short_desc: Unifying the performance and capabilities of HPC (high-performance computing).
company_long_desc: Hadean  is unifying the performance and capabilities of HPC (high-performance computing) and the commoditisation and scale of ‘big data’, with easy-to-use development tools.The applications of the technology range from financial market prediction and climate modelling to deep learning and synthetic biology.
founders_info: Alec Mocatta  built an indoor positioning company whose technology beat out Cisco and Estimote for accuracy. He sold that company during EF to work full time on Hadean.

company_short_desc: Headlight AI provides intelligent sensing and mapping software for harsh environments.
company_long_desc: Headlight AI  provides intelligent sensing and mapping software for harsh environments. Underground and other complex environments are dangerous, slow, and expensive to map and inspect. This is due to a lack of GPS, poor visibility, and hazardous conditions. Our patent-pending technology generates accurate 3D maps, even in times of poor visibility.
founders_info: Jameel Marafie  has conducted a PhD at Imperial College London in photophysics and optoelectronics. He holds Master’s degrees in Plastic Electronics from Imperial College London and in Chemistry from the University of Bath, respectively. He has also worked in consulting for over seven years.

Puneet Chhabra  has conducted a PhD between Edinburgh and Heriot-Watt universities in a new form of LiDAR signal processing and deep learning. He has an MSc degree in Computer Vision and Robotics. He won an innovation award for autonomous systems whilst at BAE Systems.

company_short_desc: Hertzwell develops hyper-resolution imaging radars for autonomous vehicles.
company_long_desc: In the last 10 years, autonomous vehicle companies have been using laser spinning systems called LiDARs for navigation. Although LiDARs have improved in resolution, they can’t penetrate rain, dust, or fog due to physical limitations of lasers.  Hertzwell  is developing high resolution 3D imaging radars to help driverless vehicles navigate in all weather conditions.This approach uses all weather radar technology from the aerospace industry and miniaturises it for autonomous vehicles.
founders_info: Bhaskar Jyoti Dutta  has over 6 years of experience in developing autonomous driving platforms. During his time in TATA, he was involved in research and development projects related to autonomous systems. He has also developed several automotive products for Fiat Chrysler and Delphi. He has a masters degree in Mechatronics from the National University of Singapore.

Ram Vignesh Palaniswamy  is an aerospace engineer with deep knowledge in radar systems that are predominantly used in the aerospace industry. He recently won an award for his work on radars from Technical University of Munich and Nanyang Technological University.

company_short_desc: Hubble is an online marketplace for renting office space.
company_long_desc: Hubble  is an online marketplace for renting office space. Hubble wraps the entire transaction: users search across office types, pay rent, sign contracts, in just a few clicks.

company_short_desc: Hydroleap is making wastewater treatment cheap, fast and easy.
company_long_desc: Hydroleap  is making wastewater treatment cheap, fast and easy. Their patent-pending design is revolutionising pre-treatment of wastewater by replacing chemical treatment with electrical treatment at scale. This leads to saving of 15 billion dollars a year.
founders_info: Mohammad Sherafatmand  did his PhD at National University of Singapore, researching the development and application of novel electrochemical technologies in water and wastewater treatment. He has more than 6 years of experience in the water industry and has collaborated with well-recognized water companies such as the Public Utilities Board (PUB).

company_short_desc: Creating next generation audio technologies for simulated worlds to replicate natural hearing.
company_long_desc: Immerzen Labs  is using advanced signal processing, machine learning and computational optimization techniques to create next generation audio technologies for simulated worlds to replicate natural hearing. Our technology will power the hardware and software for VR/AR applications including communication, gaming and education.
founders_info: Rishabh Ranjan  is an expert in the area of 3D audio, adaptive signal processing and active noise control. He has a PhD from NTU and applied machine learning and audio signal processing in developing headphones for augmented reality.

Ronak Bajaj  completed his PhD from NTU, Singapore. His research focused on fast and efficient implementations of computationally intensive signal processing applications on FPGAs. Prior to joining NTU, Ronak has worked at Xilinx Research Labs, India.
Lokesh Dhakar  is an award winning scientist with a PhD from NUS in sensor design. He also holds an MBA from NUS Business school.

company_short_desc: Matching patients with the right drugs.
company_long_desc: Inoviv  matches patients with the right drugs. We develop blood tests for major diseases to work out which patients will respond to drugs. Our unique technology, based on targeted proteomics, measures hundreds of molecules in the blood at a fraction of the cost of competitor tests, meaning we can develop tests where others cannot.
founders_info: Michael Dove  has worked in consulting and business development at top pharmaceutical and healthcare organisations (GSK, Novartis, Merck, Boston Scientific, NHS). He has relationships with hundreds of life sciences contacts up to C-suite level. He worked on two biotech startups prior to this one.

Ernestas Sirka  is a leading researcher in proteomics and clinical test development. He has 13 publications in the field and has brought five tests to market. He has a first-class degree in Molecular Biology from the University of Bath and has spent his career working at Pfizer and University College London.

company_short_desc: Insurami is re-inventing the process for leasing office spaces.
company_long_desc: Insurami  is re-inventing the process for leasing office spaces, unlocking £200bn in the US, UK and Europe alone. Our proprietary risk model enables landlords to vet customers in seconds, and lower upfront deposit costs by 90%.
founders_info: Majed Chaaraoui  spent 5 years at Blenheim Chalcot where he grew tech start-ups in financial services and property. He has worked in consulting and investment banking, and has a BEng in Electronics & Communications Engineering and an MSc in Financial Mathematics from Leeds University.

Arnor Davidsson  is experienced in software engineering, product management and UX. He has worked in both established and early stage tech companies, and previously co-founded his own start-up. He holds a BSc in Engineering Management and an MSc in Computer Science.

company_short_desc: Intelligent Robots is developing Deep Learning powered robotic alternatives to conveyor belts.
company_long_desc: Intelligent Robots  is developing Deep Learning powered robotic alternatives to conveyor belts. Our robot, rPuck, is low-cost, plug-and-play and flexible. rPuck can automatically build a map of warehouses and can go to any location on the map alongside humans without causing collisions.
founders_info: Zheng Lin  has a degree in robotics from Sheffield University and a Master’s in Artificial Intelligence from Imperial College. He also published a world class academic paper on Artificial Neural Networks.
Kaiyan Xiao  holds a Master’s degree in Advanced Computing from Imperial College where he graduated top of his class.

company_short_desc: Audiovisual assessment platform that automates your first round of interview.
company_long_desc: Modern workforces require soft skills that are hard to assess from a resume. According to Deloitte, soft-skill intensive occupations will account for two-thirds of all jobs by 2030. At Interviewer.AI, we are focused on building the penultimate step to hire great talent. We want to combine the application process with the first round of interview to help hiring Managers and recruiters not just get a holistic view of all candidates, but spot top quality talent as soon as they apply.
founders_info: Sunny SaurabhSunny Saurabh worked for over a decade in the digital industry, working on sales strategy and product ideation for companies such as LinkedIn and Google while they were still startups in Asia.

Boon Khai LimBoon Khai Lim has built large scale web application serving millions of travelers at Skyscanner. He is passionate about the use of disruptive tech, particularly the use of AI to enhance the lives of the human workforce.

company_short_desc: Intropic provides data refineries for investment management firms
company_long_desc: Intropic provides data refineries for investment management firms.During the last few years there has been an explosion in the amount of data available to use. In financial markets, information is power.Today it’s difficult and time-consuming to work with all this data but it’s too valuable to ignore. Firms spend more time preparing the data than using it.Intropic provides refineries to map and clean information from lots of sources in a way that constantly improves and adapts. It does the heavy lifting so the client can focus on managing client money.Intropic is working with over 20 leading hedge funds and their first product is built and ready to ship.
founders_info: Ravinder BhadhalRav spent the last 10 years as the Global Head of Data at Man Group. Rav’s expertise in delivering world-class data infrastructure and commercial experience of negotiating over a hundred data contracts have allowed Intropic to overcome significant barriers to entry. Rav holds a CS degree from UCL.

Sam ShannonSam was a Quantitative Trader at Segantii Capital Management and was involved in all parts of the investment process. Prior to this, Sam was at Morgan Stanley and worked on a reactive graph framework to build automated trading engines. He was awarded the Dean’s list in Particle Physics from UCL.

company_short_desc: Developing next-generation energy storage.
company_long_desc: INVOLT  is developing the next-generation energy storage, using the inherent advantages of supercapacitor technology. This will pave the way for an accelerated adoption of renewables as primary energy sources in the future power grid. Existing battery technologies are not a durable and cost-effective solution.

company_short_desc: Juniper uses hybrid deep learning to empower oncologists.
company_long_desc: Juniper  uses hybrid deep learning to empower oncologists. Currently oncologists take a time-consuming ‘one-size-fits-all’ approach to treating cancer. Many patients therefore receive suboptimal treatment that reduces their quality of life and survivability. We use hybrid deep learning to simplify the process of analyzing patient genomic data and quickly recommend personalized treatment regimens.
founders_info: Adrien Philippe  has Master’s degrees in Mathematics, Economics, and Strategic Management. He developed hybrid and large scale machine learning systems in research institutions such as MIT, and while leading teams in start-ups.

Laurence Lewis  has 10 years of experience researching at the interface of biology and technology. He has researched the biochemistry of hereditary cancer-causing mutations at Cancer Research UK and has a PhD in Systems Neuroscience from the Max Planck Institute.

company_short_desc: Juno Bio is unlocking the potential of the microbiome.
company_long_desc: Juno Bio  is unlocking the potential of the microbiome. Microbiomes are communities of bacteria that have an unprecedented potential. Juno Bio uses machine learning and state of the art bioinformatics to analyse and predict how best to manipulate microbiomes, significantly reducing the time and resources needed to drastically improve their function.
founders_info: Hana Janebdar  has a background in biochemical engineering from Imperial and UCL and worked in a microbiome optimisation laboratory, developing a patented approach to enhancing functionality.

Jonas Weissmann Gaiarsa  completed his PhD and Postdoctoral Research in Bioinformatics from the University of Sao Paulo, has 10 papers published in the field and has worked on some of the world’s biggest genomics projects.

company_short_desc: Kheiron’s Machine Learning technology makes cancer diagnoses faster, easier, cheaper and more accurate.
company_long_desc: Kheiron’s  Machine Learning technology makes cancer diagnoses faster, easier, cheaper and more accurate. Our tailored application of Machine Learning, Kheiron can save up to 60% of a radiologist’s time. Our Deep Learning algorithms analyse medical images accurately and consistently and our software uses the analysis results to enable the automation of radiology reporting tasks.
founders_info: Peter Kecskemethy  has a CS background, did a postdoc and PhD in High Performance Computing and Statistical Genetics at Oxford, has worked at 4 startups and previously founded a related teleradiology startup. He comes from a family of doctors.

Tobias Rijken  has an MSc in Computational Statistics and Machine Learning from UCL with a Deep Learning focus. He was a Machine Learning scientist at Stratified Medical applying Deep Learning in the pharmaceutical industry.

company_short_desc: Kinexcs is a building state-of-the-art monitoring products for the physical rehabilitation industry.
company_long_desc: Kinexcs  is a building state-of-the-art monitoring products for the physical rehabilitation industry. We combine advanced sensor technology with intuitive software platforms to ease remote patient-clinician interaction and provide actionable clinical data for timely intervention. This makes recovery up-to 40% faster while improving patient compliance, raising clinician productivity by up-to 1.5x.
founders_info: Abhishek Agrawal  (CEO) has previously worked in high precision manufacturing sector, where he built monitoring solutions used by companies such as Foxconn, Boeing and Airbus. He has also worked on implantable medical devices and sensor design. He possesses a joint masters in biomedical engineering from Nanyang Technological University and Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani.

Mahdi Rasouli  (CTO) has rich experience with force and tactile sensors, which have earned him accolades such as Medtronic Industry Choice Award. He received his PhD in biomedical engineering from National University of Singapore and possesses more than 15 years of research experience.

Jagjit Singh  (COO) He worked at Boston Consulting Group and as a General Manager of MOOG, where he managed 250 employees and more than $100 million in annual sales. He holds an MBA degree from University of North Carolina – Chapel Hill.

company_short_desc: Kiroku is like having an expert writing your notes for you.
company_long_desc: Kiroku  is like having an expert writing your notes for you. We are developing technology that understands conversation and derives actionable information.  We combine speech recognition with natural language understanding and intelligent translation. We are starting with the dental market, where we could potentially save $40bn worldwide.
founders_info: Hannah Burrow  qualified as a dentist from the University of Bristol. Since then, she has worked in practice, hospitals, and at Public Health England. While in practice she optimised her workflow by developing educational software for patients.

Jay Shah  has a Master’s in Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning from the University of Cambridge. At Cambridge, he built six NLP systems and performed research into language contextualisation and information extraction.

company_short_desc: Konigle is building the layer of intelligence for traditional small and medium sized businesses using automation and intelligence.
company_long_desc: Konigle  is building the layer of intelligence for traditional small and medium sized businesses using automation and intelligence. Our mission is to build the simplest user experience for small business owners to harness their unstructured and silo-ed data to make in time data driven decisions.
founders_info: Jatin Khosla  has spent 7+ years as a product leader architecting, building and scaling adoption of data driven digital products in traditional businesses, development agencies and the government.

Ashish Kumar  has a PhD in Machine learning from Nanyang Technological University. As a researcher he has developed a highly scalable framework for pattern detection from unstructured data. He has 8 publications in top journals and conferences.

company_short_desc: KroniKare provides a platform for automatic and non-invasive chronic wound assessment, as well as tracking, predicting, and data-driven reporting.
company_long_desc: KroniKare  provides a platform for automatic and non-invasive chronic wound assessment, as well as tracking, predicting, and data-driven reporting. Chronic wounds (wounds that do not heal for at least 3 months) are a rapidly growing problem that is common in patients with diabetes, obesity, cardio-vascular diseases, and aging population, costing more than $250 billion worldwide. KroniKare’s platform runs on a normal smartphone and mimics how a medical professional examines and reports on a chronic wound faster and more accurately.

company_short_desc: LEAKMITED detects water leakage from space.
company_long_desc: LEAKMITED is on a mission to preserve our most precious resource on earth: water. Every year, 15B€ of water is lost in underground distribution networks due to leakages.A leak changes the properties of the ground. We train our pattern recognition machine learning models on our unique satellite images dataset to detect whether there are leaks within 20 meters. This is a 1000x improvement.We have a paid trial worth 35k€ with la Saur, one of the world’s largest water companies, as well as access to their proprietary database (20% of the French network). We also have a signed pilot to test our MVP.
founders_info: Hubert Baya TodaHubert has a PhD in fluid dynamics and optical diagnostics and is an expert in remotely characterising materials using electromagnetic waves. He has strong execution capabilities thanks to his 3 years’ experience as Product Manager.He was 14 when he graduated from high school and he is a MBA graduate from HEC.

Juan BarraganJuan has 20 years experience in software development. His experience includes four years as a Head of Data. He studied Mathematics up to PhD level and has worked on pattern recognition in the finance and advertising industries for the past 5 years.

company_short_desc: Leif is a software platform for income-based payments.
company_long_desc: Leif  is a software platform for income-based payments. Leif allows schools, bootcamps, charities, and financial institutions to have users commit a percentage of income towards their organization in lieu of paying fixed amounts. Leif uses advanced behavioural technology to increase customer adoption and lifetime value.
founders_info: Francis Larson  holds a master’s degree from the London School of Economics and was recently named to LinkedIn’s Next Wave 120 Under 35 list.

company_short_desc: Lemnis Technologies is making VR/AR viable as the next computing platform.
company_long_desc: Lemnis Technologies  is making VR/AR viable as the next computing platform. Their patent pending technology aims to eliminate VR sickness by providing natural visual cues in 3D displays. This technology layer will be fundamental in every VR/AR headset in the next generation.
founders_info: Pierre-Yves Laffont  is an expert in Computer Vision and Computer Graphics. He was a postdoctoral researcher at ETH Zurich and Brown University, holds a PhD from INRIA, and visited MIT, UC Berkeley, and NTU. He has 13 international peer-reviewed publications.

Ali Hasnain  has an award-winning PhD from NUS with a wide range of expertise in optics, imaging, medical devices and robotics. He has over 8 years of experience building multidisciplinary solutions both in academia and industry

company_short_desc: Enabling developers to understand how their users really feel.
company_long_desc: At  Limbic , we understand that intelligence goes beyond IQ. For the first time, we enable developers to understand how their users really feel. Applying machine learning to biometric data collected by wearable devices, Limbic infers the emotional state of the user. Advances in AI and wearable sensors have only just made this possible.
founders_info: Ross Harper  has a PhD in computational neuroscience from UCL. He also holds Master’s degrees in Mathematical Modelling from UCL and Natural Sciences, from Cambridge. Having edited a Wellcome Trust-funded science magazine for multiple years, Ross is skilled in the effective communication of technical concepts.

Sebastiaan de Vries  has a proven track record building products people love. He left university to found Florin, the best peer-to -peer payment app in The Netherlands. Sebastiaan believes that the best products possess a deep understanding of how their users feel. He wants to empower their creation.

company_short_desc: Helping children around the world learn English.
company_long_desc: Lingumi  is a pre-school education company. They help children aged 2-6 around the world begin learning English using their subscription based app, Club Lingumi, and an ecosystem of complementary retail products.Pre-school children are the world’s best language learners. Parents around the world want their children to learn English from infancy, but there are no affordable, effective solutions for parents who don’t speak it themselves.
founders_info: Toby Mather  is a modern languages graduate from Oxford, a front-end web developer, and an experienced EFL teacher. He built visual language learning systems at Memrise, and worked in edtech at Emerge Education.
Adit Trivedi  is a Computer Science graduate from UCL, a Unity developer, and has 7 years of backend development experience, working at companies like Hubble, Grapple, and JP Morgan.

company_short_desc: Enabling quick feedback loops and programming in real-time.
company_long_desc: Writing code in high-performance languages is a tedious process. After each change, developers need to close, recompile and restart their application to see the result.  Loop Perfect  is a just-in-time compiler that allows developers to apply changes to a running application instantly, enabling quick feedback loops and programming in real-time.
founders_info: Nick La Rooy  is a full-stack developer who joined EF from Barclays Capital. Previously he started a games company for which he won a BAFTA Ones to Watch award. He has an MA in Artificial Intelligence & Philosophy from the University of Edinburgh.
Gaetano Checinski  is a Software Architect with many years experience creating high-performance solutions for corporates using optimisation theory and open-source technologies.

company_short_desc: Lumenora has developed the first eye-glass-frame full color AR headset with a large digital display.
company_long_desc: Lumenora  has developed the first eye-glass-frame full color AR headset with a large digital display.
founders_info: Rose Haft  started engineering in the 2nd grade, competing and winning engineering and math competitions at state, national and international levels ever since. She has studied biomedical optics at some of the world’s leading engineering schools (including Rose-Hulman, Stanford and Seoul University), has worked in public health and AI, has taught robotics and physics, and is currently building her 7th career headset with Lumenora.

company_short_desc: Machine Medicine uses computer vision to predict and prevent falls before they happen.
company_long_desc: Machine Medicine  uses computer vision to predict and prevent falls before they happen. Falls among elderly patients cost the NHS £2bn annually and £50bn in healthcare costs worldwide. A third of the falls are preventable with existing physiotherapy, but this it is not a cost effective option at scale. Machine Medcine analyses video data from CCTV systems in homes and hospitals in order to predict and prevent falls. We combine computer vision and clinical expertise to make prevention possible.
founders_info: Jonathan O’Keefe  is an Oxbridge trained doctor, neuroscientist, and machine learning engineer. He is currently a fellow in Neurology at UCLH and an academic at UCL. He has eight years of clinical experience, as well as an MSc in Machine Learning.

Georgiana Petria  has more than six years of experience in building video and computer vision products for major players such as Amazon. She holds an MSc in Computer Science from Ensimag and was previously the founder of an augmented reality startup.

company_short_desc: Machine-learning based approaches to video enhancement, prediction and compression.
company_long_desc: Magic Pony Technology  is a research-led software company developing new machine-learning based approaches to video enhancement, prediction and compression. They raised  one of Europe’s largest seed rounds  in 2015, and their team includes PhDs from the top machine learning groups at Cambridge, Oxford, and Imperial. Rob was recently named one of  Forbes’ “30 Under 30”  in technology for 2016.Just 18 months after they started Magic Pony Technology at EF, it was  acquired by Twitter for a reported $150 million .
founders_info: Rob Bishop  graduated from Imperial with a Master’s degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering, and was the first engineering employee at Raspberry Pi. He sold his first EF company Intelligent Spatial Positioning midway through EF.
Zehan Wang  has a PhD in Computer Vision and Biomedical Image Analysis from Imperial, and previously started a company using computer vision to track skin conditions. Rob and Zehan met on EF.

company_short_desc: producing world class software engineers at scale.
company_long_desc: Magic Sandbox  produces world class software engineers at scale. What makes a great developer are the years of navigating and interacting with a diverse stack at a top tech company. Such exposure doesn’t just deepen the understanding of technologies, it enables the engineer to connect the dots, and as a result solve hard problems effectively.
founders_info: Jord van den Hooff  is a full-stack designer. He moved to China aged 19, where he studied Chinese & Design. He spent 10 years building startups, including an e-commerce company. He was also UX Design Director at Razorfish and Publicis. In Europe, he joined BCG Digital Ventures as a Senior PM.

Mislav Stipetic  is a full-stack engineer. He studied CS in Zagreb (TA in Computational Theory & Compilation of Programming Languages). He was part of the Core Infrastructure team at Delivery Hero. He then joined the AI Team at Flixbus and recently led the IoT platform at Infarm.

company_short_desc: Producing breakthrough unmanned electric aircraft to power the drone industry.
company_long_desc: Marble  produces breakthrough unmanned electric aircraft to power the drone industry. We fill the gap between hobby and military systems, providing high performance and reliability to the industries that are leading the implementation of commercial applications like aerial delivery and personal transportation.
founders_info: Mathieu Johnsson  spent the last five years designing planes for the secretive Airbus Future Projects, leading the introduction of 3D printing on production aircraft, and hacking world speed record electric aircraft in his garage. He holds an MSc from Cranfield University and a skydiving licence.

Charles Peurois  has worked in the R&D lab of the World Championship winning Mercedes F1 team, developed computer tools for design and manufacture at Airbus and spent the last decade building and flying drones in his spare time. He holds an MEng from Imperial College and lands planes on the Alps’ slopes.

company_short_desc: Making 3D tools for 3D design.
company_long_desc: MΛSSLΞSS  is the future of three dimensional immersive design. We’ve a precise and intuitive tool that allows designers to break free from the surface and create in the 3D space we live in. We make 3D tools for 3D design.
founders_info: Jack A. Cohen  has a PhD in Theoretical and Computational Physics from Oxford, a Royal Academy of Engineering Enterprise Fellowship, and has been a lifelong maker and creator. He has been active in the AR/VR community presenting in Europe, Asia and America.

Dominic Hosler  has a PhD in Relativistic Quantum Communication from Sheffield, was a senior software engineer in an ISO 9001 engineering company, and recently worked in one of the top product design companies in Cambridge.

company_short_desc: Maximising crop yields with an network of planes and UAVs.
company_long_desc: Mavrx  uses a network of planes and UAVs to collect high resolution imagery, and use image analysis to generate insights to maximise crop yields. We’re active in vineyards across North America and Africa.
founders_info: Max Bruner  holds an M.Phil. in Technology Policy & Economics from the University of Cambridge and formerly served as a policy advisor to the U.S Department of Energy.
Yuan Gao  holds MEng. from the University of Oxford and is co-founder of Universal Air Ltd – which led the development of mechatronics for education and research.

company_short_desc: Deep learning software facilitating the detection of diabetic retinopathy.
company_long_desc: Diabetic retinopathy is a common complication of diabetes affecting the eye. Diabetic patients go blind if untreated before noticeable symptoms occur. Screening for this disease is however massively inefficient. Diabetes doctors cannot detect this disease, and it requires scarce eye specialists.  Medios Technologies  builds deep learning software that enables every doctor to detect diabetic retinopathy in the absence of a specialist, allowing diabetes doctors to improve their practices and prevent blindness.
founders_info: Bhargav Sosale  is a software engineer and product designer from Nanyang Technological University. He has designed and built consumer products used by thousands and comes from a family of diabetes doctors.

Florian Savoy  is computer vision and machine learning expert. He obtained his Master’s Degree form EFPL and has four years of research experience with the Advanced Digital Sciences Center, a Singapore based research lab of the University of Illinois.

company_short_desc: Merkle Science provides a risk monitoring solution to detect and prevent illegal use of cryptocurrencies.
company_long_desc: We believe that by 2030, every consumer who makes a credit card payment or a bank transfer, would have used the blockchain without even knowing it. For this to happen, regulators would play a very important role. Our vision is to be the layer of trust between banks, regulators and blockchain companies.Globally, there is a wave of upcoming cryptocurrency regulations for AML and fraud prevention (FATF, EU 5th AML Directive, SG Payment Services Bill). In order to comply, blockchain companies, funds and regulators need high-tech cybercrime tools.
founders_info: Mriganka PattnaikMriganka Pattnaik (CEO) has 6 years of experience across investment banking and technology. Before EF, he worked at Luno, a Naspers backed cryptocurrency exchange where he was responsible for business expansion as they scaled from 5 to 40 countries.

Nirmal AKNirmal AK (CTO) has 6 years of work experience as fraud data scientist at Paypal and Instamojo, an Indian payments startup. Prior to joining EF, he founded a startup which manufactured ethereum mining rigs.

company_short_desc: Optimising industrial processes using intelligent software.
company_long_desc: Many automated industrial processes suffer from inefficient operation and low yield, resulting in scrap, rework, and wasted energy.  Metis Labs  is building an intelligent software application to solve this problem. Their software learns the characteristics of any production process, allowing their customers to predict process outcomes, uncover unexpected relationships, and optimise process parameters to reduce operating costs – all in real time. Their software is easy to implement and designed for daily use by factory operators and production engineers – turning raw data into timely actions.
